intro: Memecylon sejunctum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf memecylon, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically has small, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are borne on short pedicels. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release the seeds.
